answers.answer: If the thyroid is adequately treated - which it appears to be - there should be no impact on measured metabolic parameters.  Diet/Exercise --> weight loss offers the best impact on metabolic syndrome.

question: I went to my Endocrinologist on Wednesday and they ran a bunch of blood tests with the following results:  I have Hashimotos Thyroiditis and also Antiphosopholipid Antibody Syndrome.TSH 1.22, Total T4 1.22, Total T4 9.60, Free T4 1.63, Free T3 2.58, my Serum Glucose was 105, and my Serum Creatinine 1.12.  They are concerned about possible Diabetes, Metabolic Syndrome which I am also concerned about so starting immediately I started on a special diet of mostly protein, keeping carbs under 100 grams per day and watching my sugar intake and also increasing my exercise more than I am now.  I am wondering would my thyroid or blood disease cause any of these levels (connected to the Metabolic Syndrome) to be abnormal?  And also once I see weight loss from this diet I would assume possibly these levels would come down also?  I certainly hope so I am so depressed it isn't bad enough that I have a blood disorder but also thyroid now this.Thanks for your help
title: anything associated with thyroid
